intro: Psychotria mazaruniensis, commonly known as the Mazaruni psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly found in the rainforests of Guyana and Suriname. The plant is characterized by its striking dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
